snippet: The sharpest drop in watching traditional TV was among 12- to 17-year-olds; at the same time, Americans who are 50 or older spent more time viewing.
abstract: The sharpest drop in watching traditional TV was among 12- to 17-year-olds; at the same time, Americans who are 50 or older spent more time viewing.

headline.main: Young People Are Watching Less TV, Though Still 100 Hours a Month
